title: Quiz 8: Communicable Diseases Control
description: Evaluate knowledge of disease classification, the epidemiological triad, transmission cycles, and malaria control.

questions.question: Match the epidemiological term with its definition:

pairs.right: Disease constantly present in an area
Occurring here and there without pattern

questions.explanation: These terms define the frequency and spread of diseases.

questions.question: Which component of the Epidemiological Triad refers to the disease-causing organism?
questions.explanation: The Triad consists of Agent, Host, and Environment. The Agent is the germ/organism.
questions.hint: It's the thing that acts to cause disease.

questions.question: Order the links in the Disease Transmission Cycle:
questions.explanation: The germ leaves the source, travels via a route, and enters the host.

questions.question: Which of the following are methods to interrupt the transmission route of a disease? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Treatment targets the Source. Vector control and hygiene target the Transmission Route.
questions.hint: Think about stopping the germ while it is traveling.

questions.question: Malaria is transmitted by the infected female ___BLANK___ mosquito.
questions.explanation: The Anopheles mosquito is the specific vector for human malaria.

questions.question: In the clinical stages of Malaria, which stage is characterized by profuse sweating and a drop in temperature?
questions.explanation: The sweating stage follows the hot stage and signifies the end of the paroxysm.
questions.hint: The name of the stage describes the symptom.

questions.question: What is the term for the time between infection and the appearance of the first signs and symptoms?
questions.explanation: Incubation period is the silent phase before illness becomes apparent.
questions.hint: Like an egg waiting to hatch.

questions.question: Review the classification table below. Which disease is correctly classified as 'Water Borne'?
